glsa.title: GNU cpio: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Two vulnerabilities have been found in GNU cpio, the worst of which could result in execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: GNU cpio copies files into or out of a cpio or tar archive.

description.p: Two vulnerabilities have been discovered in GNU cpio:

ul.li: The list_file function in GNU cpio contains a heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability (CVE-2014-9112)
A directory traversal vulnerability has been found in GNU cpio (CVE-2015-1197)

impact.p: A remote attacker may be able to entice a user to open a specially crafted archive using GNU cpio, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code, a Denial of Service condition, or overwriting arbitrary files.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All GNU cpio users should upgrade to the latest version:
